translation.description: I'm a software engineer specializing in building (and occasionally designing) exceptional digital experiences. Currently, i'm focused on building mobile React-Native applications and full-stack web applications.
translation.aboutIntro: Hi. I'm Carlos Daniel, nice to meet you. Please take a look around.
translation.aboutMe: I am a 20 year old Computer Science student, I'm currently in the 5º semester. I have been always interested in computers and programming. I started learning some python when I was about 14 years old, but I really fell in love when I started learn html, css and javascript, because things were more concrete, and I could get an immediate return on what I built, it was sensational to see that I could create amazing things. And then I decide to get into this world, and became a programmer and started the Computer Science Bachelor. Since this I'm passionate about building websites and everything about programming.
translation.theTechnologies: These are the technologies I've worked with or studied
translation.recentWork: Check out some of my recent work
translation.passMouseToSee: Pass the mouse over the cards to see more
translation.clickDescription: Click here to see the description
translation.codetowerWorkDesc: Led the team in carrying out projects. In the organization, it ranges from planning, project standards, agile methodologies, etc. I also help with project programming, using various technologies such as Nextjs, Django and Docker, among others.
translation.conteWorkDesc: I work on maintaining and implementing projects, internal and for clients, for mobile devices. From creation to publication in the main app stores such as Apple Store and Google Play
translation.submitForm: Submit the form or shoot me an email - carlosdanielf541@gmail.com
translation.scrollToSee: Scroll down to see my social media
translation.name: Name
translation.crudDesc: Website creation where it is possible to register people, edit and delete, the famous crud. The application was made end to end, from the front-end using react, to the back-end creating an api and database. To carry out this project, in addition to React's own concepts such as componentization, other tools were also used, for the construction of the back-end/api, express js/node.js was used, and for the database MySql was used. The front-end was deployed on netfly and the backend on heroku.
translation.cafeChat: Website creation, imitating whatsapp, where it is possible to add chats through email. React js was used to build the front-end and firebase as the database. The styled components library, react-icons, react-hooks-firebase, among others, was used a lot in this project.
translation.pokedexDesc: Pokédex project where you can search pokémons through name or ID, in addition to going through each pokémon through the button. In this project we used html, css and javascript. The most important learning point of this project was learning how to make an api request, it was the first application I made that makes this type of request.
translation.pomodoroDesc: Site that implements the Pomodoro technique, a technique that helps productivity and focus. This project was built using html, css and javascript. In this project, the concepts of DOM (Document Object Model), DOM events, creation of functions, in addition to the use of the setInterval function were used.
translation.foodDesc: Landing page made imitating fast food websites. In this project I practiced my css skills, and tested new things. It's a simple but well-crafted project, being fully responsive.
translation.ranchoDesc: Freelance project carried out to publicize a Rancho. It consists of a landing page, made with nextjs, where I use the concept of components. In addition, in this project I used the meta's instagram api to show the latest publications from the ranch.
translation.benserDesc: In this project I became a junior fullstack dev at IFG's Code Tower junior company. I participated in the development of small features in the project. However, I was able to develop a lot as a programmer, I had the opportunity to work on both the frontend and backend of the project.
translation.doulasDesc: I worked on the project, leading the completion of the project for an institutional website and membership management system. During completion we organized several sprints. In addition, I worked directly programming together with the project team and helping them with execution, mainly on the frontend. In this project we use NextsJS, Java Spring, Postgresql and Docker.
translation.viajahDesc: I led the project, as well as implemented almost the entire API and did important parts of the frontend implementation, such as authentication and the blog. In this project we use Nextjs, Django, Docker, among other technologies. In addition to the development and leadership of the project, I also took care of the project's deployment, which was done on a VPS using Docker, with a CI/CD pipeline with gh actions and watchtower. I can be important from end to end in this project.
translation.cryptoDesc: Project made for a selection process challenge. In this project I managed to learn many fundamental concepts of React, such as react-router-dom for routing with pure react and redux for state management and persistence. In addition, I integrated with metamask, thus being able to display the wallet ID and balance. This application's main objective is to display cryptoactive information and for this purpose I use the CoinGecko API. To better visualize the data, I used the rechart library to create graphs of the data coming from the api.
translation.etoroksDesc: Freelance project for a sweepstakes platform for a YouTube channel. The platform allows the registration of sweepstakes and their respective achievements by the admin. It also allows users to connect using Google through Firebase Auth and register for a prize draw. On this platform, Nextjs, Firebase (firestore, auth, storage) and shadcn ui were used as component librarie.
translation.codeTowerDesc: Institutional website made for the junior company Code Tower. Single page, where services, about the company, articles and projects are shown. For the blogs, the Dev.to platform was used to write the articles, and in the application we consumed the api to get the data and display it. And to register projects more easily, HygraphCMS was used to manage project content, and to retrieve this data from the CSM I use GraphQL.
